title: Avoid undefined function call preventing build on some systems
body_html: On some Linux systems (tested on several machines, all running Arch Linux or Arch Linux-derived distributions), at build time, a call to unistd.h's function read(int, void*, unsigned int) is performed as read(int, char*, unsigned int), leading to undefined function reference and preventing a successful build. This modification aims to fix said behaviour, while not impacting (theoretically) systems/library versions which still allowed a successful build before.
body_text: On some Linux systems (tested on several machines, all running Arch Linux or Arch Linux-derived distributions), at build time, a call to unistd.h's function read(int, void*, unsigned int) is performed as read(int, char*, unsigned int), leading to undefined function reference and preventing a successful build. This modification aims to fix said behaviour, while not impacting (theoretically) systems/library versions which still allowed a successful build before.
body: On some Linux systems (tested on several machines, all running Arch Linux or Arch Linux-derived distributions), at build time, a call to `unistd.h`'s function `read(int, void*, unsigned int)` is performed as `read(int, char*, unsigned int)`, leading to undefined function reference and preventing a successful build. This modification aims to fix said behaviour, while not impacting (theoretically) systems/library versions which still allowed a successful build before.
